As a doctor, I‚Äôve seen the physical and emotional trauma of domestic and sexual violence firsthand. No woman or family should ever have to live in the shadow of fear and abuse. #VAWA

Recent surveys show that 40 to 60 percent of the AAPI women community experiences physical or sexual violence by an intimate partner in their lifetime. It is critical that we help survivors feel supported and heard, especially in a culturally appropriate context. #VAWA

I was proud that my amendment was included in #VAWA, which enhances culturally specific services for these victims. Domestic violence is a devastating reality for many women in the US, and in particular for the Asian American and Pacific Islander community.

The House passed today the Violence Against Women Reauthorization Act, which will continue to provide critical resources for survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault. #VAWA pic.twitter.com/xybtj6XvCC
Americans deserve an easy and effective way to enroll in affordable coverage.
This is why I‚Äôm introducing the Pathway to Universal Coverage Act. This bill would help states expand health care coverage to millions of Americans and experiment with automatic enrollment.

Today, more than 27 million Americans remain uninsured, despite the fact that as many as half are eligible for coverage with no or very low premiums. 

What's stopping them? Health insurance is complicated and people are busy.  https://bit.ly/2YHXL7Y¬† via @thehill
